p: Given that NHBE cells are appropriate to study viral cellular tropism, several studies have used them to compare various avian influenza strains [ 265, 266, 267, 268]. NHBE cells predominantly display α2,6 linkage sialic acids receptors as well as α2,3 sialic acid receptors [ 269, 270]. Since avian viruses generally bind to α2,3 receptors [ 271], using such cells would provide a better predictive ability of a novel viral strain in causing severe influenza in humans.
